data.title: Add 32bit ARM armel & armhf GNU/Linux support
data.body:
The following cross compile packages needs to be installed on the build server:
gcc-arm-linux-gnueabi
g++-arm-linux-gnueabi
gcc-arm-linux-gnueabihf
g++-arm-linux-gnueabihf

JDK 8 ARM systems will try to load:
libgdxarmgnueabi.so -> 32bit ARM GNU softfp EABI
libgdxarmgnueabihf.so -> 32bit ARM GNU hard float EABI

JDK 6/7 ARM systems will try to load:
libgdxarm.so -> 32bit ARM unknown ABI.
We will use the gnueabihf compiler for JDK systems with unknown ABI.

Signed-off-by: Xerxes Rånby xerxes@gudinna.com

data.title: Optimization of actor's traversal path when a sequence of move to actions are applied to it
Fix problem with running already finished actions by ParallelAction.
data.body:
### What Have I Done?

This is fix for issue found in Actions.parallel. Issue may cause crash or malfunction. 
### Issue description

In some cases, when actions to not track it when they are finished and such action is used together with actions that works longer than just one execution (eg. Actions.moveTo(x, y, 1f)). 
Than Actions.parallel() will not care if this small Actions was finished or not, and run it multiple times or even crashes is some cases.
### Example

When you have code like this: 
Actions.parallel( Actions.moveTo(x, y, 1f), Actions.addAction( Actions.moveTo(x2, y2, 1f), someActor)); then libgdx crahses.
Actions.addAction is executed several times. "someActor" has several references to same action, when first action is remover, all other have null pointer inside and crashes.

Proposal: Lua extension
data.body:
Why Lua? Because games like WoW made it super popular and choice #1 for scripting in games.
I think that scripting support is the last thing that people can miss from libGDX.
I am working on Lua backend for Java written mostly in C++ and based on LuaJava, so it is really fast compared to popular Lua backend LuaJ. And it is tested and working on all platforms that libGDX supports (except Gwt). It is also compatible with libGDX build system as I used jnigen there.

You can view gdx-compatible branch of it here: https://github.com/nondev/nonlua/tree/experimental
I am still working on it but I think in a week or so I will finish it.

I am willing to offer this project to libgdx as extension (something like gdx-lua). What do you think about it? There are still some parts of LuaJava (with proper license headers), but as they are under MIT license, I think it shouldn't be problem.

I also posted thread on [forums](http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=17&t=19443) but forum is a bit inactive.

P.S Sorry for my English

data.title: TextField with Chinese initial value will break incremental chinese freeTypeFont
(OOP) modify Model class to allow subclasses with custom loading sequence calling existing loading methods
data.body:
To implement a different `load()` behaviour, one currently has to Ctrl+C/Ctrl+V the entire related code from Model, even if it is necessary to only change a slightest bit.

The proposed solution would be to change all related methods () from `private` to `final protected`, allowing easy modular changes and/or replacements via subclasses with constructors calling no-arg `Model()` c-tor with custom `load()` variant.

As a side note, `nodePartBones` can be made either final and accessible for subclasses via `final protected`, to allow using it in custom subclass loader, or (possibly better, since AFAIK it's only used during loading and just hogging the memory for the Model later on) converted from field to `loadNodes()` method variable, passed to `loadNode()` as a parameter.

If this's somewhat too big for an instant dev patch, I'd be more than happy to do a PR for it.

data.title: Fixes incorrect label colors under certain circumstances.
data.body:
Fixes incorrect tint color occurring if label has a non-white setColor tint applied and label’s computePrefSize method called while label is in non-wrapping state or has ellipses set.

Problem with improper label colors occurring on non-white labels in a scrollpane when scrollbar appears has been traced to here. We shouldn’t ignore resetting color to white upon compute size, otherwise the cache font’s current color is used which, if not white, will not provide a proper base for tinting when drawn.

data.title: Label layout color glitch fix
data.body: If a tinted label (having its color set via setColor instead of style font) was not wrapped or had ellipses set then the label’s layout’s font color would not be set to white but would instead be set to it’s last used color. Therefore when draw() tinted the layout you ended up with compounded and incorrect tinting.

data.title: relative and absolute paths on Android
data.body:
Hey All,

I'm having an issue with loading a g3dj with relative links to texture files.  It seems that android, specifically wants texture files in the same directory as the model.  Desktop accepts relative links without issue.  

For example, the following works on Desktop (OSX), not on Android. 

``` javascript
// snippet from g3dj file
"textures": [
                      {
                           "id": "Texture.005",
                           "filename": "../materials/miami-hurricanes-tiled.jpg",
                           "type": "DIFFUSE"
                      }
                 ]
```

I have tried both relative and absolute path format
Relative: "../materials/miami-hurricanes-tiled.jpg" // should navigate one up from current directory
Absolute: "/materials/miami-hurricanes-tiled.jpg"  // should navigate from top level of assets folder

Here is my assets directory hierarchy: 

![screen shot 2015-05-28 at 2 51 09 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/317561/7884982/5a0ed4d2-05ef-11e5-93ae-f3c3a388e48c.png)

The error from LogCat reports: 
05-28 15:16:45.243: E/AndroidRuntime(2681): com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't load dependencies of asset: models/../materials/miami-hurricanes-tiled.jpg

What DOES work, is having the texture file in the same directory as the g3dj file.

data.title: Texture Wrap does not work for non-power-of-two images on iOS
data.body:
Simplest method to reproduce this error (for iOS):
1. Setup default project with project setup JAR
2. Resize the included "badlogic.jpg" from 256x256 to 256x257 or some non-power-of-2 dimensions.
3. Enable Texture Wrap on the image with the following line placed within the create method:
`img.setWrap(TextureWrap.Repeat, TextureWrap.ClampToEdge);`

Result will be a black void where the image is expected to be. If either the image is power-of-two or Texture Wrap is disabled, the image will appear correctly.
